channel.title: New York Post
channel.description: Your source for breaking news, news about New York, sports, business, entertainment, opinion, real estate, culture, fashion, and more.

item.title: Model attacked by blood-sucking beach bugs — still covered in bumps months later
item.dc:creator: Asia Grace
item.content:encoded: "You just can't stop scratching until you rip the skin and even though the skin is ripped, you can't feel any pain because you're that itchy,” she said.

media:content.media:title: Chelsie Gold was attack by microscopic, bloodsucking sandflies, which left her body covered in scars and scabs for months.
Months later, Gold is still suffering with blemishes from the attack.
Gold had no idea that the black specs on her body were actually sandflies, biting into her flesh.
Chelsie Gold was attacked by microscopic, bloodsucking sand flies, which left her body covered in scars and scabs for months.
Although Gold doesn't want to hamper anyone's beach fun, she warns vacationers to be mindful of the tiny creepy-crawlies.
